message.content:
cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.NA 

This paper deals with the problem of recovering low-rank and sparse matrices from incomplete or corrupted observations, which is a common problem in machine learning, statistics, bioinformatics, computer vision, signal and image processing. Therefore, it could belong to several arXiv CS sub-categories. 

cs.LG (Machine Learning): This paper proposes a scalable, provable structured low-rank matrix factorization method to recover low-rank and sparse matrices from missing and grossly corrupted data. 

cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): The problem of recovering low-rank and sparse matrices from incomplete or corrupted observations is a common problem in computer vision and image processing. 

cs.IT (Information Theory): The paper deals with the problem of recovering low-rank and sparse matrices from incomplete or corrupted observations, which is related to information theory and signal processing. 

cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms): The paper proposes an algorithm to efficiently solve the problem of recovering low-rank and sparse matrices from incomplete or corrupted observations, which is related to data structures and algorithms. 

cs.NA (Numerical Analysis): The paper proposes a numerical method to solve the problem of recovering low-rank and sparse matrices from incomplete or corrupted observations, which is related to numerical analysis.
